Detailed Description

Represents the physical location of an IP address.

The class is initialized by passing the constructor an IP address. It finds the physical location of that address and the class provides functions for getting various bits of information about the location as well as a friendly preformatted "city, state, country" location string.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

__construct ( $  req_ip  ) 

IPGeolocation constructor. Creates a new IPGeolocation object reperesnting one IP address/location.

Parameters:
$req_ip The IP address to be located.
Returns:
True if the IP was located successfully.

False if the IP location failed; check class error variable.

getCountryCode (  ) 

Gets the country code of the IP address. Typically, this will return an abbreviation for the country.

Note:
The (incomplete) API docs do not clearly specify this behavior.
Returns:
The IP's country code (eg. US) in a string.

The IP's physical location in a string with format "city, region, country"

getLatLonAssoc()

getLatLon (  ) 

Gets the IP's approximate latitude and longitude. Returns the IP's (approximate) latitude and longitude in a numerically-indexed array.

Returns:
A numerically-indexed array representing the IP's location. $return[0] holds the latitude of the IP address. $return[1] holds the longitude.
See also:
getLatitude()

getLongitude()

getLatLonAssoc()

getLatLonAssoc ( $  latKey = 'latitude',
$  lonKey = 'longitude' 
)

Gets the IP's approximate latitude and longitude. Returns the IP's (approximate) latidude and longitude in an associative array.

Parameters:
$latKey The array key to associate with latitude (default "latitude")
$lonKey The array key to associate with longitude (default "longitude")
Returns:
An associative array representing the IP's location.
See also:
getLatitude()

getLongitude()

getLatLon()

getLocationProperties ( $  regionNameKey = 'region',
$  countryNameKey = 'country',
$  cityKey = 'city',
$  postalCodeKey = 'postalCode',
$  latKey = 'latitude',
$  lonKey = 'longitude',
$  regionCodeKey = 'regionCode',
$  countryCodeKey = 'countryCode' 
)

Returns an associative array containing all location data returned by the API. Returns an associative array, whose keys can be chosen by the user in the function call, containing all meaningful (location) data returned by the geolocation API. Data returned are country name, country code, region/state name, region/state code, city, zip/postal code, latitude (approx), longitude (approx).

Parameters:
$regionNameKey Array key for region name. Default "region". May be useful to redefine as "state".
$countryNameKey Array key for country name. Default "country"
$cityKey Array key for city name. Default "city"
$postalCodeKey Array key for postal/zip code. Default "postalCode"
$latKey Array key for latitude (returned in decimal format). Default "latitude"
$lonKey Array key for longitude (returned in decimal format). Default "longitude"
$regionCodeKey Array key for region code. Default "regionCode"
$countryCodeKey Array key for country code. Default "countryCode"
Returns:
Associative array containing all location data returned by the API.

getPostalCode (  ) 

Gets the IP's postal/zip code.

getRegion (  ) 

Gets the IP's region (or state).

Returns:
The IP's region (aka state) in a string.
See also:
getFriendlyLocation()

getRegionCode (  ) 

Gets the IP's region (or state) code. This will return whatever the API says is the region code.

Note:
The region code is not clearly specified in the (weak) API docs; it is unclear what this does. It looks like this is an internal reference. Your application should never need to access this.
Returns:
The IP's region code.

Field Documentation

$error = false

Holds a string if there is an error in the class; remains FALSE if everything is OK
